newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HKFE launches rolling forex British pound contract.
newsitem.headline: HKFE launches rolling forex British pound contract.

text.p: The British pound contract of rolling forex began trading on the Hong Kong Futures Exchange (HKFE) on Thursday.
The HKFE launched the currency futures product on November 3 and already trades rolling Deutschemark and Japanese yen forex contracts.
In the pound contract, the market maker system will also provide continuous quotations with a maximum spread of five points under normal market conditions.

"The introduction of a third currency in our Rolling Forex market in less than a year demonstrates that HKFE has successfully established a new foreign currency market mechanism in Hong Kong," said Ivers Riley, HKFE chief executive officer, in a statement.
"This rare momentum is typical of our product diversification efforts," Riley said.
The contract size for the British pound contract is 50,000 pounds with a minimum fluctuation of 0.0001 and a tick value of US$5, the statement said.
The minimum initial margin rates for clients will be set at US$3,500 per lot, and the minimum maintenance margin rate for clients will be US$2,800 per lot, it said.
